post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, May 25
post.Content:
It's already late May - this year is racing by! Take some time out today to enjoy the following links :-)

JavaFX

  • Tom Schindl has posted about code editors with JavaFX. This is really impressive stuff!
  • Jens Deters has released MQTT.fx 0.0.15, which includes a few bug fixes and new features.
  • Speaking of Jens, he also posted a YouTube video showing a responsive user interface written in JavaFX in various mobile form factors.
  • Lee Stemkoski has posted a long article titled 'Introduction to JavaFX for Game Development'.
  • The Gluon guys have posted more details about Gluon Glisten (their commercial Java library). Johan Vos from Gluon was also interviewed by Voxxed where he provides a bunch of insight into the thinking behind Gluon. Finally, Gluon has posted a blog post where they detail their plan for offering JavaFX training courses, and where people can register their interest.
  • Geertjan Wielenga has posted about 'news from the Modular JavaFX Application Framework'.
  • Ren√© Jahn has posted about adding zoom support to the open source JVx library.
  • Nicolai Parlog has posted about the implications of JDK 9, and how JEP 253 is working to mitigate them.
  • Ernest Duodu has posted about how to create a JavaFX GUI using Scene Builder in NetBeans.
  • Rahman Usta has posted code on GitHub for a JavaFX terminal emulator.

A great set of links this week - I hope you enjoyed them. Catch you next week! :-)
